quiz_metadata.title: AWS Services Quiz
quiz_metadata.description: Test your knowledge of Amazon Web Services

questions.question: What does S3 stand for?
questions.explanation: S3 stands for Simple Storage Service, AWS's object storage service.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used for content delivery?
questions.explanation: CloudFront is AWS's CDN service for content delivery.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of AWS Lambda?
questions.explanation: Lambda provides serverless computing, allowing you to run code without managing servers.

questions.question: Which service provides managed NoSQL database?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL database service.

questions.question: What does IAM stand for?
questions.explanation: IAM stands for Identity and Access Management, used for controlling access to AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides virtual servers in the cloud?
questions.explanation: EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides scalable virtual servers in the cloud.

questions.question: What is Amazon RDS used for?
questions.explanation: RDS (Relational Database Service) makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale relational databases.

questions.question: Which service would you use for DNS management in AWS?
questions.explanation: Route 53 is AWS's scalable DNS and domain name registration service.
